result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Basterash was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 8:30 am.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges on COUNT 1. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge on COUNT 1.
Obtain HSED and maintain at least 20 hours of employment per week. Once the HSED is completed, defendant is to continue with vocational training or maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week.

No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 16 years.
Defendant may not maintain any social media accounts.

Electronic devices must be turned over to agent for inspection upon demand.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.
Provide any prescription to agent PRIOR to filling them.
Sex offender evaluation and comply with recommended treatment /counseling.
Court will defer a ruling on sex offender registration until a probation review date.
Department of Corrections to submit a report to the Court for the probation review hearing. ******************************************************************

09/29-2017/ Judge Mark Sanders 
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect that the order for sex offender registration is VACATED.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count one. Credit for one (1) day.

miscConds.notes: Court WAIVED costs, fees, surcharges, and DNA surcharge on COUNT 2 as it is part of a continuous event.

records.addlTxt: amended. Assessments now entered correctly.

Defendant Jacob A Basterash in court with Attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Jacob A Basterash in custody.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Also present in court, Probation Agent David Allen.
Probation hearing commences.  Defendant has been revoked and is serving a sentence until October 15.  
Issue before the court as to sex offender registry.  Arguments by the State and defense counsel.

Court finds that the crime was sexually motivated; further it is in the best interest of the community.
Defendant is ordered to register with the Sex Offender Registry and maintain compliance for 15 years.

JOC, Criminal Complaint, and Court Record sent to Valeria Taylor, Attorney at Law (State Public Defender - 819 N 6th St.).

Defendant Jacob A Basterash in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea and sentencing hearing. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.

Defendant sworn in.
As to COUNTS 1 & 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgments of conviction entered. Court advised the defendant of the sex offender registry requirements.

Defendant Jacob A Basterash in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  Cynthia M. Davis on behalf of Erin Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for pre-trial conference. Branch 25 in trial and unable to hear this matter. Defense counsel has received discovery from the State and requests a plea and sentencing date. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with B.K. DOB 11-6-98.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jacob A Basterash in court with attorney Eduardo M. Borda.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 25.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
